page.title: 09Peterlee Maternity Unit.
page.content:
In 1887{Thorpe Hospital}was used for infectious diseases, in 1949 it became a maternity hospital, and in 1985 it may become a hospital for the elderly. On June 24th 1985 a public meeting organised by{Hartlepool, Durham and {Sunderland Community Health Councils, was attended by 230 people who discussed a{proposed change for Thorpe {Hospital,}with its maternity services being split between Sunderland and Hartlepool.
The case put was that Thorpe no longer meets national standards, it would not be a cut in services because better care could be provided in central units, and there was a need for beds for elderly.{Local people disagreed. They have "... had enough of half baked ideas rushed through by people who do not know the area."
